segments.text: The art critic from the daily chronicle doesn ’ t think much of the max oreo exhibition . He says that the artwork is uninspiring and old fashioned .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Really ? I thought the exhibition showed that he had real talent . What did you think of it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I liked it . I didn ’ t think his works were masterpieces , but the certainly weren ’ t uninspiring , in my opinion .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don ’ t think I ’ Ve ever read a good review of an exhibition by that critic . He doesn ’ t seem to like anything . Which kinds of paintings do you prefer ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I like landscapes and still life . You prefer abstract paintings , don ’ t you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I do . I like painters who use rather than watercolors . The colors appear richer . What do you think ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I agree . I prefer oils too . I collect landscapes , but I only have a small collection . You have a small collection of abstract art , don ’ t you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . Good artwork is very expensive nowadays . When I was in china , I bought some calligraphy by famous artists . You should come and see it sometime .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That would be nice . Can you read the characters ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know what the characters on the paintings mean . I think Chinese characters look very artistic . It ’ s said that the way they are written can give insight into the artist ’ s character .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think that ’ s true with any of the fine arts .
segments.speaker: S1
